bioghist.p: J. Bruce Bredin was born in Wilmington, Delaware. Bredin attended the University of Delaware and the College of William and Mary, as well as the Wharton School of the University of Pennsylvania. In 1957 Bredin joined the University of Delaware's Board of Trustees and served as its chairman from 1982-1988. During his tenure on the board, he chaired the Executive Committee, the Honorary Degrees and Awards Committee and the Art and Humanities Committee and served on the committees on Grounds and Buildings, Student Personnel Services and Welfare, Education and Training, Nominating and Physical Education, Athletics and Recreation. In 1991 Bredin was awarded an honorary doctor of humane letters degree from the University of Delaware.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of the personal and professional papers of Bruce Bredin, including materials related to the Bredin Foundation, Unidel Foundation, and the Winterthur Board of Trustees. Materials include: business and personal correspondence; bylaws, and articles of incorporation of the Bredin Foundation; minutes and financial statements of the Bredin Foundation (1958-1993); and files on a variety of subjects including the University of Delaware, William and Mary College, the Historical Society of Delaware, and the Bredins' travel and other interests.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
